intro: Bulbinella filiformis, commonly known as the slender bulbinella, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant has a compact growth habit with a short, creeping rhizome and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and they are borne in clusters on short stalks. Bulbinella filiformis is often found in sandy or rocky soils in coastal areas, thriving in well-drained conditions.
